column4: How come my linux laptop cannot resolve a computers hostname but my windows machine can?
.. woops, nibbler already answered that. can you give us the hostname you're trying to resolve?
its just the name of the computer. Loungeroom-PC
... yes, but where do you enter it?
hmm, seems like that could be either SMB or FTP or SFTP... I guess its a window share then, tho.
well, pinging would resolve names differently than smb would. at least usually.
I bet you can ping the computer's IP address if it is not firewalled or the router prevents it, tho.
yes i can ping the ip, but not the hostname.
That's because the name resolution for windows shares and web sites / pinging / etc can work differently.
My router can see the names of my windows machines, how come it cant see linux?
Again, it is important to tell what "type" of name you mean... regular host names as used for web servers and such, or the windows share names?

you know what? do you have bind and its tools installed on your ubuntu? you can use "dig" to query the regular name servers as they are used on the internet (no netbios), that might answer some questions.
Grawity, i figured it out. I had to add wins to /etc/nsswitch.conf
I think we can set up the linux machines similarly if we know whether you need samba, a normal name server entry (possibly asked for by dhcp) ...
